intro: Pedicularis gyrorhyncha subsp. gyrorhyncha, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive hooded shape. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine habitats. It has fleshy roots and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
